Authors:
Ruvishika Shehali Jayawardena, XingHong Li, Jiye Yan,
Guozhen Zhang, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
Colletotrichum species associated with strawberry anthracnose
in China
Keywords:
GADPH, C. fructicola, C. nymphaeae, molecular,
morphology
Abstract:
Understanding the species concepts in the genus
Colletotrichum have achieved considerable advances, which has led to the
need to carry out fresh surveys of the species of this genus associated
with important hosts. Strawberry anthracnose is an important disease in
China that results in significant economic losses. The disease is caused
by a number of Colletotrichum species that have yet to be characterised
using modern concepts. A survey of strawberry fields in eight provinces
of China was carried out to identify the causal agents of strawberry
anthracnose. Multilocus gene analysis (ITS, GADPH, CHS, ACT and TUB2)
coupled with morphology revealed disease associated taxa were from two
species complexes, namely the C. gloeosporioides species complex and C.
acutatum species complex. Colletotrichum nymphaeae belongs to the C.
acutatum species complex and C. fructicola, and a new species C.
guozheniae belongs to the C. gloeosporioides species complex. The latter
species is introduced in this paper, with an illustrated account and
compared with similar taxa. The new species is phylogenetically most
close to C. theobromicola and pathogenicity tests proved that it is
pathogenic to the strawberry crown, fruits and leaves.
